016package edu.cnm.deepdive.codebreaker.viewmodel;
017
018import android.content.Context;
019import android.content.SharedPreferences;
020import androidx.lifecycle.DefaultLifecycleObserver;
021import androidx.lifecycle.LiveData;
022import androidx.lifecycle.Transformations;
023import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel;
024import dagger.hilt.android.lifecycle.HiltViewModel;
025import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext;
026import edu.cnm.deepdive.codebreaker.service.PreferencesRepository;
027import javax.inject.Inject;
028import kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1;
029
030/**
031 * Provides access (for a UI controller or data-bound view) to some subset of the current
032 * preferences state. While {@link PreferencesRepository} provides access to the full
033 * {@link android.content.SharedPreferences} of the app, this class takes the approach of using
034 * {@link Transformations#map(LiveData, Function1)} to provide {@link LiveData}-based read-only
035 * access to individual preference values. This approach is of most use when an instance of a
036 * {@link androidx.preference.PreferenceFragmentCompat} subclass is used to modify
037 * {@link android.content.SharedPreferences}, and the preference values need to be used (but not
038 * modified) in other UI controllers.
039 */
040@HiltViewModel
041public class PreferencesViewModel extends ViewModel implements DefaultLifecycleObserver {
042
043  // TODO Declare LiveData fields for individual preferences as necessary.
044
045  @Inject
046  PreferencesViewModel(@ApplicationContext Context context, PreferencesRepository repository) {
047    LiveData<SharedPreferences> prefs = repository.getPreferences();
048    // TODO Initialize LiveData fields (as needed) for individual preferences.
049  }
050
051}
